DataElement.preferredName: Personal Medical History Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to the patient's medical records or background of any abnormal conditions as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Personal Medical History Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Personal Medical History Disease or Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a history o
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of any of the following within the last 6 months prior to study entry: Ischemic myocardial event, including angina requiring therapy and artery revascularization procedures. Ischemic cerebrovascular event, including TIA and artery revascularization procedures. Requirement for inotropic support (excluding digoxin) or serious (uncontrolled) cardiac arrhythmia (including atrial flutter/fibrillation, ventricular fibrillation or ventricular tachycardia). Or pulmonary embolism.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has newly diagnosed, unresectable, metastatic and measureable ASPS who show clinical evidence of disease progression (including history and increasing physical symptoms) is there documentation that includes a physician's rationale that supports evidence of clinical disease progression (i.e., increasing tumor pain)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of HSCT, are they more than 90 days removed from the date of stem cell infusion, have no evidence of acute graft-versus-host disease (GVHD) or active chronic (grade 2-4) GVHD, and are off of all transplant-related immunosuppression for at least 2 week?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any of the following: History of myocardial infarction within six months or unstable angina or history of CVA within 6 months or New York heart association grade II or greater congestive heart failure or significant vascular disease (e.g. aortic aneurysm, history of aortic dissection) or clinically significant peripheral vascular disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a previous history of non-breast malignancy, are the following criteria for a cancer survivor met: Has undergone potentially curative therapy for all prior malignancies and has been considered disease-free for at least 1 year (with the exception of basal cell or squamous cell carcinoma of the skin or carcinoma-In-situ of the cervix)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has newly diagnosed, unresectable, metastatic and measureable ASPS, does patient show clinical evidence of disease progression (including history and increasing physical symptoms) and there is on-study documentation that includes a physician's rationale that supports evidence of clinical disease progression (i.e., increasing tumor pain)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of abdominal fistula, does the fistula history meet the following: (a) the fistula was surgically repaired, (b) there has been no evidence of fistula for at least 6 months prior to starting treatment, (c) patient is deemed to be at low risk of recurrent fistula, and (d) the case must be discussed with the study PI?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a recent history of thyroiditis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of allogeneic HSCT, are they more than 90 days removed from the date of stem cell infusion, have no evidence of acute graft-versus-host disease (GVHD) or active chronic (grade 2-4) GVHD, and are off of all transplant-related immunosuppression for at least 2 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any of the following cardiac diseases currently or within the last 6 months as defined by New York Heart Association (NYHA) greater than or equal to Class 2: Unstable angina pectoris, Congestive heart failure, Acute myocardial infarction, Conduction abnormality not controlled with pacemaker or medication, or Significant ventricular or supraventricular arrhythmias?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of myelodysplastic syndrome/acute myeloid leukemia or with features suggestive of MDS/AML?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of any of the following within the last 6 months prior to study entry: Ischemic myocardial event, including angina requiring therapy and artery revascularization procedures. Ischemic cerebrovascular event, including TIA and artery revascularization procedures. Requirement for inotropic support (excluding digoxin) or serious (uncontrolled) cardiac arrhythmia (including atrial flutter/fibrillation, ventricular fibrillation or ventricular tachycardia). Pulmonary embolism. New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class III or IV heart failure. Or placement of a pacemaker for control of rhythm.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of myelodysplastic syndrome/acute myeloid leukemia or with features suggestive of MDS/AML on peripheral blood smear?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prior history of T-LBL/T-ALL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of another malignancy except for: any malignancy that was treated with curative intent, has no known active disease present for greater than or equal to 1 year before the first dose of study drug, and is felt to be at low risk of recurrence by the treating physician; adequately treated non-melanoma skin cancer or lentigo maligna without evidence of disease; adequately treated carcinoma in situ without evidence of disease; or Low-risk prostate cancer after curative surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN), Stevens-Johnson syndrome, or phospholipid syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA), myocardial infarction, or unstable angina within the previous 6 months before starting therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of T-LBL/T-ALL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled to the atezolizumab + bevacizumab combination arm, does patient have a history of bleeding varices within 1 year of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a CNS disorder such as cerebrovascular ischemia/hemorrhage, dementia, cerebellar disease, or autoimmune disease with CNS involvement that in the judgement of the investigator may impair the ability to evaluate neurotoxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a CNS disorder such as cerebrovascular ischemia/hemorrhage, dementia, cerebellar disease, or autoimmune disease with CNS involvement that in the judgement of the investigator may impair the ability to evaluate neurotoxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there clinical, biopsy proven or radiologic evidence of local tumor recurrence in the prostate and/or periprostatic or seminal vesicle region after radiotherapy, or in the prostate bed after prostatectomy

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of cerebrovascular accident, myocardial infarction, or unstable angina within the previous 6 months prior to study treatment initiation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prior history of T-cell lymphoblastic lymphoma (T-LBL) or T-cell acute leukemia (T-ALL)?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 8/4/2022: fixed the box symbol in AQT_wz
